summary_md: This round fixes the verifier’s two seam inconsistencies by splitting each S-node into S1 (variable side) and S2 (clause side) with separate choice and phase subtracks, adding offer bits and read-only lbit/rbit mirrors, and specifying Selected (sgnsel) wiring. Outer seams enforce mirroring/pointer-exposure and offer gating; central seam (B=2) has an explicit allowed-pair table (Idle, EqStart, EqL[b]/EqR[b], NeqStart, NeqPick[b]/NeqCheck[b], CAP/PAD) synchronizing phases but leaving bit-tests to local pointer-integrity lanes. Pointer-integrity uses Address–RIDbit–Return triads and comparator tiles; Selected=1 activates exactly one clause bundle, with any inconsistency triggering a 1–2 step error-chain that flips Role→Neutral. The Barrier Lemma places Bar nodes adjacent to each block footer so only nearest blocks can participate in a certificate; this enforces (F2) automatically (no ⊥-plumbing). Exclusivity (E′) follows: RID=ip enables (CAP,CAP) only, RID≠ip enables (PAD,PAD) only. Alphabet size remains poly(s)+O(B) = poly(s). Citations: prover-01.out.json (progress_md).
highlights: Resolved seam contradictions by splitting S into S1/S2 with separate truth/occ, phase, offer, and mirrored bit lanes.
Explicit B=2 central-seam pair table synchronizes phases (Idle, Eq*, Neq*, CAP/PAD) while bit-tests live in local pointer lanes.
Pointer-integrity: Address–RIDbit–Return triads plus comparator tiles enforce equality/inequality locally; mismatches trigger error-chains flipping Role→Neutral within ≤2 steps.
Selected wiring: exactly one clause bundle marked Selected=1; any Selected/inconsistency mismatch produces a local deactivation (RoleR→NeutralCla).
Barrier Lemma: nearest-block barriers force choices=⊥ and phase=Neutral beyond nearest blocks, so (F2) holds without ⊥-fill.
Exclusivity E′: RID=ip permits (CAP,CAP) iff sign matches; RID≠ip permits (PAD,PAD); mutual exclusion enforced by seam tables and local markers.
